Name: Albacore
Description: Uses recurrent neural networks (RNN) that claim to substantially improve single-read and consensus accuracy

Publications.Title: DeepNano: Deep recurrent neural networks for base calling in MinION nanopore reads

Name: Aligner comparisons
Description: Evaluates short-read alignment tools (i.e. STAR, Tophat2, Hisat2, bbmap, gmap) for long read alignment

Publications.Title: Evaluation of tools for long read RNA-seq splice-aware alignment

Name: AlignQC
Description: Uses 3 layers of quality assessments; (1) basic statistics of the data, including read length, alignment and coverage across all chromosomes; (2) error pattern analysis if a reference genome is provided; (3) transcript-related statistics if a gene annotation is provided.  Alignqc takes the standard BAM format file as the input, outputs XHTML format file for easy visualization, and provides links to access all analysis results.

Publications.Title: Comprehensive comparison of Pacific Biosciences and Oxford Nanopore Technologies and their applications to transcriptome analysis

Name: ALLPATHS-LG/Discovar
Description: Uses hybrid and debruijin graphs

Publications.Title: High-quality draft assemblies of mammalian genomes from massively parallel sequence data

Name: Architect
Description: A genomic scaffolder aimed at synthetic long read and read-cloud sequencing technologies

Publications.Title: Genome assembly from synthetic long read clouds

Name: ARCS
Description: Scaffolding genome assemblies

Publications.Title: ARCS: scaffolding genome drafts with linked reads

Name: Arrow
Description: Arrow is an improved consensus model (phase out of Quiver) based on a more straightforward hidden Markov model approach

Name: Assembler comparisons
Description: Tested on abyss, Celera, Velvet and SSAKE. Concludes saying that OLC can be considered as a favourable algorithmic framework for the development of assembler tools for Nanopore-based data

Publications.Title: Benchmarking of de novo assembly algorithms for Nanopore data reveals optimal performance of OLC approaches

Name: Base caller comparisons
Description: Compares Albacore, Guppy, Scrappie, deepnnano, Chiron

Name: BaseModsTools
Description: Tools for optimizing and quality checking performance of basemods and related tools on PacBio Data

Name: Betaduck
Description: For tidying the PromethION outputs and visualising the data

Publications.Title: BLAT---The BLAST-Like Alignment Tool

Name: C3POa
Description: Computational pipeline for calling consensi on R2C2 nanopore data

Name: Canu
Description: Detect overlaps in high-noise sequences using MHAP. Generate corrected sequence consensus. Trim corrected sequences. Assemble trimmed corrected sequences. Takes all-vs-all read self-mappings (typically by minimap) as input and outputs an assembly graph in the GFA format. Different from mainstream assemblers, miniasm does not have a consensus step. It simply concatenates pieces of read sequences to generate the final contig sequences. Thus, the per-base error rate is similar to the raw input reads.

Publications.Title: Canu: scalable and accurate long-read assembly via adaptive k-mer weighting and repeat separation

Name: cellRanger
Description: Et of analysis pipelines that process Chromium single-cell RNA-seq output to align reads, generate gene-cell matrices and perform clustering and gene expression analysis

Name: Chiron
Description: A deep learning CNN+RNN+CTC structure to establish end-to-end base calling. Built with tensorflow and python 2.7.

Publications.Title: Chiron: translating nanopore raw signal directly into nucleotide sequence using deep learning

Name: Circlator
Description: Circularizes genome assemblies

Publications.Title: Circlator: automated circularization of genome assemblies using long sequencing reads

Name: CS
Description: Generate isoform-based alignments and exon-based alignments

Name: D-GENIES
Description: An online tool designed to compare two genomes. It supports large genome and you can interact with the dot plot to improve the visualisation

Publications.Title: D-GENIES: dot plot large genomes in an interactive, efficient and simple way

Name: DALIGNER
Description: Utilizes efficient k-mer matching to detect long-read overlaps and must rely heavily on filtering repetitive k-mers for efficiency as all k-mers in all reads are considered.

Publications.Title: Efficient Local Alignment Discovery amongst Noisy Long Reads

Name: davidcoffey/MinION
Description: A pipeline for calling structural variants

Publications.Title: Mapping and phasing of structural variation in patient genomes using nanopore sequencing

Name: DeepSimulator
Description: Deep learning based Nanopore simulator which can simulate the process of Nanopore sequencing.

Publications.Title: DeepSimulator: a deep simulator for Nanopore sequencing

Name: Falcon
Description: OLC approach

Publications.Title: Phased diploid genome assembly with single-molecule real-time sequencing

Name: Filtlong
Description: Filter long read data by quality and create a subset of smaller but “better” in quality based on read length and read identity

Name: Flye
Description: Combination of de bruijin graph and OLC approach

Publications.Title: Assembly of long error-prone reads using de Bruijn graphs
GMAP: a genomic mapping and alignment program for mRNA and EST sequences

Name: haplotyped-methylome
Description: Reproducibility workflow for Gigante et al., 2018: Using long-read sequencing to detect imprinted DNA methylation

Name: HGAP
Description: A pipeline for assembling reads and error correcting

Publications.Title: Nonhybrid, finished microbial genome assemblies from long-read SMRT sequencing data

Name: Hinge
Description: It is an OLC(Overlap-Layout-Consensus) assembler
License: Copyright (c) 2016, Govinda Kamath, Fei Xia, Ilan Shomorony, Thomas Courtade and David Tse. All rights reserved

Publications.Title: HINGE: long-read assembly achieves optimal repeat resolution

Name: INC-Seq
Description: Extracts repeating sequence segments and corrects them by constructing a consensus sequence

Publications.Title: Minimap2: pairwise alignment for nucleotide sequences

Name: levelfind_poreseq
Description: Extract signal levels and noise information of DNA bases using a Bayesian model

Name: Mandalorion-Episode II
Description: Mandalorion defines isoforms based on splice site, TSS and polyA site usage

Publications.Title: Nanopore long-read RNAseq reveals widespread transcriptional variation among the surface receptors of individual B cells

Name: marginCaller
Description: Currently through this model it is possible to get multiple substitutions called at a site, if two non-reference bases both have posterior probability greater than 0.3. Margincaller does not currently report reference base probs

Publications.Title: Improved data analysis for the MinION nanopore sequencer

Name: MARVEL
Description: A tool that provides overlapping, patching, correction and assembly of long reads

Publications.Title: The axolotl genome and the evolution of key tissue formation regulators

Name: MaSuRCA
Description: Combines the benefits of deBruijn graph and Overlap-Layout-Consensus assembly approaches. Since version 3.2.1 it supports hybrid assembly with short Illumina reads and long high error PacBio/MinION data

Publications.Title: Hybrid assembly of the large and highly repetitive genome of Aegilops tauschii, a progenitor of bread wheat, with the MaSuRCA mega-reads algorithm

Name: mCaller
Description: A binary classifier to improve bacterial base modification N6-methyladenine (m6a) classification by marking adenines as methylated or unmethylated based on differences between measured and expected current values as each adenine travels through the nanopore.

Publications.Title: Nanopore detection of bacterial DNA base modifications

Name: MECAT
Description: an ultra-fast Mapping, Error Correction and de novo Assembly Tool.

Publications.Title: MECAT: fast mapping, error correction, and de novo assembly for single-molecule sequencing reads
MetaSV: an accurate and integrative structural-variant caller for next generation sequencing

Name: MHAP
Description: Uses a dimensionality reduction technique named minhash to create a more compact representation of sequencing reads. Originally developed to determine the similarity of web pages, minhash reduces a text or string to a small set of fingerprints, called a sketch.

Publications.Title: Assembling large genomes with single-molecule sequencing and locality-sensitive hashing

Name: miniasm
Description: Takes all-vs-all read self-mappings (typically by minimap) as input and outputs an assembly graph in the GFA format. Different from mainstream assemblers, miniasm does not have a consensus step. It simply concatenates pieces of read sequences to generate the final contig sequences. Thus, the per-base error rate is similar to the raw input reads.

Publications.Title: Minimap2: pairwise alignment for nucleotide sequences

Name: Minidot
Description: Creates dotplots from minimap2 results

Publications.Title: Minimap and miniasm: fast mapping and de novo assembly for noisy long sequences

Name: Minimap2
Description: Maps reads to a human genome

Publications.Title: Minimap2: pairwise alignment for nucleotide sequences

Name: MultiQC
Description: Summarise and analyse results for multiple tools and samples in a single report

Publications.Title: MultiQC: summarize analysis results for multiple tools and samples in a single report

Name: Nanocorr
Description: Error correction tool for ONT data
License: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

Publications.Title: Oxford Nanopore sequencing, hybrid error correction, and de novo assembly of a eukaryotic genome

Name: Nanocorrect*
Description: A simple error correction method inspired by pbdagcon. Quite slow and other methods have superceeded the capability of this tiool. Hence, it was depriciated.

Publications.Title: A complete bacterial genome assembled de novo using only nanopore sequencing data

Name: NanoPack
Description: A set of tools developed for visualization and processing of long-read sequencing data from Oxford Nanopore Technologies and Pacific Biosciences.

Publications.Title: NanoPack: visualizing and processing long-read sequencing data

Name: NanoPipe
Description: Provides alignments to any target of interest, alignment statistics and information about polymorphisms

Name: NanoPlot
Description: Plotting reads and alignments

Publications.Title: NanoPack: visualizing and processing long-read sequencing data

Name: nanoplotter
Description: Plotting functions of Oxford Nanopore sequencing data

Publications.Title: Design tools for MPRA experiments

Name: nanopolish
Description: An algorthm to analyse ONT data at signal level

Publications.Title: Detecting DNA cytosine methylation using nanopore sequencing

Name: nanoraw
Description: The first algorithm for the identification of modified nucleotides without the need for prior training data along with the open source software implementation.

Publications.Title: De novo Identification of DNA Modifications Enabled by Genome-Guided Nanopore Signal Processing

Name: NanoSV
Description: Identifies split- and gapped-aligned reads and clusters the reads according to the orientations and genomic positions of the read segments to define breakpoint-junctions of structural variations

Publications.Title: Mapping and phasing of structural variation in patient genomes using nanopore sequencing

Name: nanotest
Description: Small test datasets for testing nanopack scripts and modules

Name: NaS
Description: Combines Illumina and Oxford Nanopore technologies to produce synthetic aligned reads upto 60kb with no errors and spans repetitive regions

Publications.Title: Genome assembly using Nanopore-guided long and error-free DNA reads

Name: pbbioconda
Description: The integration of alignment, polishing, variant calling, SV analysis, etc. In one package

Name: PBcR*
Description: A correction algorithm and assembly strategy that uses short, high-fidelity sequences to correct the error in single-molecule sequences.

Publications.Title: Assembling large genomes with single-molecule sequencing and locality-sensitive hashing

Name: pbdagcon
Description: Have implemented DAGCon (Directed Acyclic Graph Consensus) which is a sequence consensus algorithm based on using directed acyclic graphs to encode multiple sequence alignment

Name: PBHoney
Description: Considers both intra-read discordance and soft-clipped tails of long reads to identify structural variants.

Publications.Title: PBHoney: identifying genomic variants via long-read discordance and interrupted mapping

Name: pbssc
Description: PacBio's CCS method in SMRT Analysis 2.3 cannot distinguish between the strands of heteroduplex amplicons, so pbssc is a workaround method that is compatible with SMRT Analysis 2.3 and the .bax.h5 files generated from RSII instruments.

Publications.Title: Analysis of recombinational switching at the antigenic variation locus of the Lyme spirochete using a novel PacBio sequencing pipeline

Name: pbsv
Description: A suite of tools to call and analyse structural variants in diploid genomes

Name: Pbsv_polish
Description: Polish structural variants

Name: pinfish
Description: Annotate genomes using ONT data

Name: pipeline-pinfish-analysis
Description: Annotating genomes using long read transcriptomics data with pinfish

Name: plotnanopolish
Description: Scripts for plotting nanopolish methylation data

Name: Porechop*
Description: Remove adapters through alignments

Name: poremap
Description: Pipeline for nanopore read alignment and statistics

Name: Poreplex
Description: A signal-level pre-processor for Oxford Nanopore direct RNA sequencing (DRS) data that does alignments with minimap2 and outputs fastq files for further processing.

Name: POREquality
Description: An R Markdown script designed to run as part of a Nanopore local base calling pipeline. Porequality reads Nanopore sequencing summary files to generate an aesthetically pleasing HTML report to facilitate the visualization of key metrics.

Name: PoreSeq
Description: De novo sequence using the discretised ionic current data from an arbitrary number of independent nanopore reads of the same region of DNA

Publications.Title: De novo sequencing and variant calling with nanopores using PoreSeq

Name: poreTally
Description: Benchmarking of assembling tools (e.g. Canu, minimap2, for user provided datasets

Publications.Title: poreTally: run and publish de novo Nanopore assembler benchmarks

Name: pychopper
Description: Tool to identify full length cDNA reads

Name: pycoQC
Description: Computing metrics and generating plots from Oxford Nanopore Albacore report

Name: QUAST
Description: Evaluating large-scale genome assemblies

Publications.Title: QUAST: quality assessment tool for genome assemblies

Name: QUAST-LG
Description: Improved version of QUAST

Publications.Title: Versatile genome assembly evaluation with QUAST-LG

Name: R2C2
Description: More accurate reads from nanopore sequencing through Rolling Circle Amplification to Concatemeric Consensus method

Publications.Title: Improving nanopore read accuracy with the R2C2 method enables the sequencing of highly multiplexed full-length single-cell cDNA

Name: satlacc
Description: Trims adapter sequences, retrieves optional UMI's, clusters reads and produces a consensus sequence for each cluster after multiple sequence alignment

Name: shishir-reddy/nanopore-pipeline
Description: Based on David Coffey’s pipeline above

Name: SignalAlign
Description: This paper presents one of the first methods able to detect methylation changes directly from Oxford Nanopore long- read sequencing. It can detect three cytosine variants and two adenine variants.

Publications.Title: Mapping DNA methylation with high-throughput nanopore sequencing

Name: SMARTdenovo
Description: Overlap-layout-consensus (OLC) approach

Publications.Title: A general method applicable to the search for similarities in the amino acid sequence of two proteins

Name: SMRT-SV
Description: Structural variant (SV) and indel caller for PacBio reads

Publications.Title: Resolving the complexity of the human genome using single-molecule sequencing

Name: Sniffles
Description: Uses evidence from split-read alignments, high-mismatch regions, and coverage analysis from sorted alignment outputs of BWA-MEM

Publications.Title: Accurate detection of complex structural variations using single molecule sequencing

Name: SPAdes
Description: Tested on bacterial genome and uses de Bruijn graph approach.

Publications.Title: SPAdes: A New Genome Assembly Algorithm and Its Applications to Single-Cell Sequencing
Transient structural variations have strong effects on quantitative traits and reproductive isolation in fission yeast

Name: TAPIS
Description: For correcting and aligning long reads with/without a second generation reads, transcript clustering, novel and full-length splice isoform detection, and identification and analysis of polyAdenylation (poly(A)) and alternative poly(A) (APA).

Publications.Title: A survey of the sorghum transcriptome using single-molecule long reads
Comprehensive transcriptome analysis using synthetic long-read sequencing reveals molecular co-association of distant splicing events

Name: Tombo
Description: A suite of tools primarily for the identification of modified nucleotides

Publications.Title: Detecting DNA cytosine methylation using nanopore sequencing

Name: Unicycler
Description: Assemble Illumina (uses spades), ONT, PacBio (uses miniasm+Racon) or hybrid data for bacterial genomes

Publications.Title: Unicycler: Resolving bacterial genome assemblies from short and long sequencing reads
